intro: Pasania harmandii, commonly known as the Harmand's pasania, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
